citation.article-title: Enterococcus columbae, a species from pigeon intestines.

p.s: Description of Enterococcus columbae sp. nov.
(co.lumb'ae. L. n. columba pigeon; gen. s. n. columbae of pigeons)
The strains grew to fairly large, non-haemolytie, enterococcal-like colonies on blood agar: 2-3 mm in diameter, regular, somewhat mucoid, unpigmented and semi-opaque.
In broth they formed deposits with a turbid supernatant and they appeared as short chains composed of 2 to 4 Gram-positive cocci.
Growth on agar plates was better when incubation at 35-37°C was performed in 3-10% CO2 than in air.
Their requirement for CO2 was not absolute.
All strains were catalase-negative and facultatively anaerobic.
They failed to grow on Slanetz-Bartley Medium.
They appeared to be resistant to 40% bile and were able to grow on Bile Aesculin agar when incubated in 3 to 10% CO2 but not in air, and they all failed to grow in broth with 6.5% NaCl.
They grew on Edward's Medium and hydrolysed aesculin on this medium.
On Mitis-Salivarius agar they formed small colonies or showed
partly inhibited growth.
The 9 strains were all positive in the Voges Proskauer reaction and produced α-galactosidase, alkaline phosphatase and leucine-arylamidase.
They did not hydrolyse arginine and hippurate and also their β-ghicuronidase and pyrrohdonylarylamidase reactions were negative.

Acid productionfrom carbohydrates was positive with α-arabinose, mannitol, ribose, D-xylose, galactose, D-glucose, D-fructose, D-mannose, sorbitol, amethyl-D-glucoside, N-acetyi glucosamine, arbutine, aesculin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, melibiose, saccharose, trehalose, inulin, D-raffinose,
amidon and β-gentiobiose.

Negative carbohydrate reactions were noted with erythritol, D-arabinose, L-Iyxose, adonitol, glycerol, β-methyl-xyloside, L-sorbose, dulcitol, inositol, α-methyl-D-mannoside, D-lyxose, D-fucose, L-fucose, L-arabitol, glycogen, gluconate and 5-ketoghicohate.

Variable results were obtained with β-galactosidase (strains P100, P52, d23 and STR 487: positive), rhamnose (only d23 and P107 positive), amygdaline (strains 100, P52, d23 and P8: positive), lactose (only P26 and P1 negative), melezirose (only STR 345 positive), D-tagatose (only STR345, P8 and d23 positive), D-turanose (only STR345 weakly positive), xylitol (only strain P52 positive), D-arabitol (only STR 345, P100 and P107 negative) and 2-ketogluconate (only STR 487 positive).
None of the strains reacted with the Streptococcus group A, B, C, D, G and F antisera in coagglutination tests.
The DNA base composition of the type strain is 38.2 mol% G + C (as determined by melting temperature).
Habitat: intestines of pigeons.
The type strain is STR 345 (NCIMB 13013) and has been deposited at The National Collections of Industrial and Marine Bacteria, Torry Research Station,
Aberdeen, Scotland.
